Odinist

The reformed Norse Pagan faith has a Holy Book written in runes with chapters on Creation, the gods, Ragnarok, and secret spells - 'galdrs'. The church has a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy led by the Fylkir, who - much like an Islamic Caliph - is both a secular ruler and the religious leader of the faithful. Odinist

The Odinists are Norse heretics who believe Odin is the only true God, the rest of the pantheon being 'mere' demigods. Similar to the reformed faith, they are organized with a head and a priestly class, but unlike the reformed faith the head is not a secular ruler. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can perform coastal raids anywhere
§Y*§! Fleets can navigate major rivers
§Y*§! Can call Great Holy Wars
§Y*§! Loses prestige when at peace for too long, but vassals do not resent levies
Norse Mysticist

Mysticists are Norse heretics who believe that everyone have the potential for godhood, and that the Norse pantheon became deities due to their great knowledge of seid or their use of magical artifacts. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! Can perform coastal raids anywhere
§Y*§! Fleets can navigate major rivers
§Y*§! Low-tech Non-pagans suffer attrition in Mysticist land
§Y*§! Rulers may adopt Seid
§Y*§! Landed nobles may own temple holdings

The Allfather may be wise and know much, but he still needs men on Midgard to fight for the Aesir. The Sons of Odin are a military order of the reformed Norse, fighting for the Allfather in order to gain a seat in Valhall.

This character is widely recognized as an authority in spiritual matters.

An old wanderer claims to have heard of your desire to become recognized as a Gode, wise in the ways of the gods. He offers to teach you, but warns of a heavy price for his knowledge... He demands you give him one of your fingers.
What? Throw this old madman out at once!
No, I know enough already.

Odinism, a radical Norse heresy, have taken root in one of your lands. Odinism venerates Odin above all other Gods, and in fact claims Odin is the only real God. The other Gods, according to the Odinists, are mere demigods compared to Odins' omniscience and omnipotence.
This sounds dangerously Christian to me.
There is no Gods but Odin, and we'll kill anyone who says different!
Doubts regarding the reformed Norse Faith, with its church hierarchy and its dogmas, have been gnawing at your mind for months. The ancestors had no Fylkir, so why should we?
Hail Odin, the only Lord of the Spirit!
We can All be as Gods!
The Old Ways are the Best Ways!
I think I can live with it.
